overview: In this specialisation, you will gain an understanding of deaf education and learn strategies for assessing, supporting and promoting communication, language and literacy development in students with a hearing loss. It is ideal for those interested in working as a Teacher of the Deaf in a mainstream setting or school for the deaf.

Deaf Education students must demonstrate successful completion of Module 1 of Auslan Certificate 2 (or equivalent) before they can commence their final placement. Auslan courses are offered at a number of TAFE colleges (or equivalent) nationally.

Structure: Students taking the Deaf Education specialisation will need to complete:
62.5 credit points of specialisation core subjects

Subject Options.EDUC90505: Listening and the Learning Environment Credits
